00140 static int maxdata= 500000, maxnr= 50000;
00141 static int nr_names=0;
00142 static int nr_types=0;
00143 static int nr_structs=0;
00144 static char **names, *namedata;     /* at address names[a] is string a */
00145 static char **types, *typedata;     /* at address types[a] is string a */
00146 static short *typelens;             /* at typelens[a] is de length of type a */
00147 static short *alphalens;            /* contains sizes as they are calculated on the DEC Alpha (64 bits), infact any 64bit system */
00148 static short **structs, *structdata;/* at sp= structs[a] is the first address of a struct definition
00149                                      * sp[0] is type number
00150                                      * sp[1] is amount of elements
00151                                      * sp[2] sp[3] is typenr,  namenr (etc) */
00160 static int debugSDNA = 0;
00161 static int additional_slen_offset;

00224 
00225 static int add_type(const char *str, int len)
00226 {
00227     int nr;
00228     char *cp;
00229     
00230     /* first do validity check */
00231     if (str[0]==0) {
00232         return -1;
00233     }
00234     else if (strchr(str, '*')) {
00235         /* note: this is valid C syntax but we can't parse, complain!
00236          * 'struct SomeStruct* somevar;' <-- correct but we cant handle right now. */
00237         return -1;
00238     }
00239     
00240     /* search through type array */
00241     for (nr=0; nr<nr_types; nr++) {
00242         if (strcmp(str, types[nr])==0) {
00243             if (len) {
00244                 typelens[nr]= len;
00245                 alphalens[nr] = len;
00246             }
00247             return nr;
00248         }
00249     }
00250     
00251     /* append new type */
00252     if (nr_types==0) cp= typedata;
00253     else {
00254         cp= types[nr_types-1]+strlen(types[nr_types-1])+1;
00255     }
00256     strcpy(cp, str);
00257     types[nr_types]= cp;
00258     typelens[nr_types]= len;
00259     alphalens[nr_types]= len;
00260     
00261     if (nr_types>=maxnr) {
00262         printf("too many types\n");
00263         return nr_types-1;
00264     }
00265     nr_types++;
00266     
00267     return nr_types-1;
00268 }

00279 static int add_name(const char *str)
00280 {
00281     int nr, i, j, k;
00282     char *cp;
00283     char buf[255]; /* stupid limit, change it :) */
00284     const char *name;
00285 
00286     additional_slen_offset = 0;
00287     
00288     if (str[0]==0 /*  || (str[1]==0) */) return -1;
00289 
00290     if (str[0] == '(' && str[1] == '*') {
00291         /* we handle function pointer and special array cases here, e.g.
00292          * void (*function)(...) and float (*array)[..]. the array case
00293          * name is still converted to (array*)() though because it is that
00294          * way in old dna too, and works correct with elementsize() */
00295         int isfuncptr = (strchr(str+1, '(')) != NULL;
00296 
00297         if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("\t\t\t\t*** Function pointer or multidim array pointer found\n");
00298         /* functionpointer: transform the type (sometimes) */
00299         i = 0;
00300 
00301         while (str[i] != ')') {
00302             buf[i] = str[i];
00303             i++;
00304         }
00305         
00306         /* Another number we need is the extra slen offset. This extra
00307          * offset is the overshoot after a space. If there is no
00308          * space, no overshoot should be calculated. */
00309         j = i; /* j at first closing brace */
00310 
00311         if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("first brace after offset %d\n", i);
00312 
00313         j++; /* j beyond closing brace ? */
00314         while ((str[j] != 0) && (str[j] != ')' )) {
00315             if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("seen %c ( %d)\n", str[j], str[j]);
00316             j++;
00317         }
00318         if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("seen %c ( %d)\n"
00319                                   "special after offset%d\n",
00320                                   str[j], str[j], j);
00321                 
00322         if (!isfuncptr) {
00323             /* multidimensional array pointer case */
00324             if (str[j] == 0) {
00325                 if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("offsetting for multidim array pointer\n");
00326             }
00327             else
00328                 printf("Error during tokening multidim array pointer\n");
00329         }
00330         else if (str[j] == 0 ) {
00331             if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("offsetting for space\n"); 
00332             /* get additional offset */
00333             k = 0;
00334             while (str[j] != ')') {
00335                 j++;
00336                 k++;
00337             }
00338             if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("extra offset %d\n", k);
00339             additional_slen_offset = k;
00340         }
00341         else if (str[j] == ')' ) {
00342             if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("offsetting for brace\n");
00343             ; /* don't get extra offset */
00344         }
00345         else {
00346             printf("Error during tokening function pointer argument list\n");
00347         }
00348                 
00349         /*
00350          * Put )(void) at the end? Maybe )(). Should check this with
00351          * old sdna. Actually, sometimes )(), sometimes )(void...)
00352          * Alas.. such is the nature of braindamage :(
00353          *
00354          * Sorted it out: always do )(), except for headdraw and
00355          * windraw, part of ScrArea. This is important, because some
00356          * linkers will treat different fp's differently when called
00357          * !!! This has to do with interference in byte-alignment and
00358          * the way args are pushed on the stack.
00359          *
00360          * */
00361         buf[i] = 0;
00362         if (debugSDNA > 3) printf("Name before chomping: %s\n", buf); 
00363         if ((strncmp(buf,"(*headdraw", 10) == 0) ||
00364             (strncmp(buf,"(*windraw", 9) == 0) )
00365         {
00366             buf[i] = ')';
00367             buf[i+1] = '(';
00368             buf[i+2] = 'v'; 
00369             buf[i+3] = 'o';
00370             buf[i+4] = 'i';
00371             buf[i+5] = 'd';
00372             buf[i+6] = ')';
00373             buf[i+7] = 0;
00374         }
00375         else {
00376             buf[i] = ')';
00377             buf[i+1] = '(';
00378             buf[i+2] = ')';
00379             buf[i+3] = 0;
00380         }
00381         /* now precede with buf*/
00382         if (debugSDNA > 3)  printf("\t\t\t\t\tProposing fp name %s\n", buf);
00383         name = buf;
00384     }
00385     else {
00386         /* normal field: old code */
00387         name = str;
00388     }
00389     
00390     /* search name array */
00391     for (nr=0; nr<nr_names; nr++) {
00392         if (strcmp(name, names[nr])==0) {
00393             return nr;
00394         }
00395     }
00396     
00397     /* append new type */
00398     if (nr_names==0) cp= namedata;
00399     else {
00400         cp= names[nr_names-1]+strlen(names[nr_names-1])+1;
00401     }
00402     strcpy(cp, name);
00403     names[nr_names]= cp;
00404     
00405     if (nr_names>=maxnr) {
00406         printf("too many names\n");
00407         return nr_names-1;
00408     }
00409     nr_names++;
00410     
00411     return nr_names-1;
00412 }
00413 
00414 static short *add_struct(int namecode)
00415 {
00416     int len;
00417     short *sp;
00418 
00419     if (nr_structs==0) {
00420         structs[0]= structdata;
00421     }
00422     else {
00423         sp= structs[nr_structs-1];
00424         len= sp[1];
00425         structs[nr_structs]= sp+ 2*len+2;
00426     }
00427     
00428     sp= structs[nr_structs];
00429     sp[0]= namecode;
00430     
00431     if (nr_structs>=maxnr) {
00432         printf("too many structs\n");
00433         return sp;
00434     }
00435     nr_structs++;
00436     
00437     return sp;
00438 }
00439 
00440 static int preprocess_include(char *maindata, int len)
00441 {
00442     int a, newlen, comment = 0;
00443     char *cp, *temp, *md;
00444     
00445     /* note: len + 1, last character is a dummy to prevent
00446      * comparisons using uninitialized memory */
00447     temp= MEM_mallocN(len + 1, "preprocess_include");
00448     temp[len]= ' ';
00449 
00450     memcpy(temp, maindata, len);
00451     
00452     // remove all c++ comments
00453     /* replace all enters/tabs/etc with spaces */
00454     cp= temp;
00455     a= len;
00456     comment = 0;
00457     while (a--) {
00458         if (cp[0]=='/' && cp[1]=='/') {
00459             comment = 1;
00460         }
00461         else if (*cp<32) {
00462             comment = 0;
00463         }
00464         if (comment || *cp<32 || *cp>128 ) *cp= 32;
00465         cp++;
00466     }
00467     
00468 
00469     /* data from temp copy to maindata, remove comments and double spaces */
00470     cp= temp;
00471     md= maindata;
00472     newlen= 0;
00473     comment= 0;
00474     a= len;
00475     while (a--) {
00476         
00477         if (cp[0]=='/' && cp[1]=='*') {
00478             comment= 1;
00479             cp[0]=cp[1]= 32;
00480         }
00481         if (cp[0]=='*' && cp[1]=='/') {
00482             comment= 0;
00483             cp[0]=cp[1]= 32;
00484         }
00485 
00486         /* do not copy when: */
00487         if (comment);
00488         else if ( cp[0]==' ' && cp[1]==' ' );
00489         else if ( cp[-1]=='*' && cp[0]==' ' );  /* pointers with a space */
00490 
00491         /* skip special keywords */
00492         else if (strncmp("DNA_DEPRECATED", cp, 14)==0) {
00493             /* single values are skipped already, so decrement 1 less */
00494             a -= 13;
00495             cp += 13;
00496         }
00497         else {
00498             md[0]= cp[0];
00499             md++;
00500             newlen++;
00501         }
00502         cp++;
00503     }
00504     
00505     MEM_freeN(temp);
00506     return newlen;
00507 }
00508 
00509 static void *read_file_data(char *filename, int *len_r)
00510 {
00511 #ifdef WIN32
00512     FILE *fp= fopen(filename, "rb");
00513 #else
00514     FILE *fp= fopen(filename, "r");
00515 #endif
00516     void *data;
00517 
00518     if (!fp) {
00519         *len_r= -1;
00520         return NULL;
00521     }
00522 
00523     fseek(fp, 0L, SEEK_END);
00524     *len_r= ftell(fp);
00525     fseek(fp, 0L, SEEK_SET);
00526 
00527     data= MEM_mallocN(*len_r, "read_file_data");
00528     if (!data) {
00529         *len_r= -1;
00530         fclose(fp);
00531         return NULL;
00532     }
00533 
00534     if (fread(data, *len_r, 1, fp)!=1) {
00535         *len_r= -1;
00536         MEM_freeN(data);
00537         fclose(fp);
00538         return NULL;
00539     }
00540     
00541     fclose(fp);
00542     return data;
00543 }
00544 
00545 static int convert_include(char *filename)
00546 {
00547     /* read include file, skip structs with a '#' before it.
00548      * store all data in temporal arrays.
00549      */
00550     int filelen, count, overslaan, slen, type, name, strct;
00551     short *structpoin, *sp;
00552     char *maindata, *mainend, *md, *md1;
00553     
00554     md= maindata= read_file_data(filename, &filelen);
00555     if (filelen==-1) {
00556         printf("Can't read file %s\n", filename);
00557         return 1;
00558     }
00559 
00560     filelen= preprocess_include(maindata, filelen);
00561     mainend= maindata+filelen-1;
00562 
00563     /* we look for '{' and then back to 'struct' */
00564     count= 0;
00565     overslaan= 0;
00566     while (count<filelen) {
00567         
00568         /* code for skipping a struct: two hashes on 2 lines. (preprocess added a space) */
00569         if (md[0]=='#' && md[1]==' ' && md[2]=='#') {
00570             overslaan= 1;
00571         }
00572         
00573         if (md[0]=='{') {
00574             md[0]= 0;
00575             if (overslaan) {
00576                 overslaan= 0;
00577             }
00578             else {
00579                 if (md[-1]==' ') md[-1]= 0;
00580                 md1= md-2;
00581                 while ( *md1!=32) md1--;        /* to beginning of word */
00582                 md1++;
00583                 
00584                 /* we've got a struct name when... */
00585                 if ( strncmp(md1-7, "struct", 6)==0 ) {
00586 
00587                     strct = add_type(md1, 0);
00588                     if (strct == -1) {
00589                         printf("File '%s' contains struct we cant parse \"%s\"\n", filename, md1);
00590                         return 1;
00591                     }
00592 
00593                     structpoin= add_struct(strct);
00594                     sp= structpoin+2;
00595 
00596                     if (debugSDNA > 1) printf("\t|\t|-- detected struct %s\n", types[strct]);
00597 
00598                     /* first lets make it all nice strings */
00599                     md1= md+1;
00600                     while (*md1 != '}') {
00601                         if (md1>mainend) break;
00602                         
00603                         if (*md1==',' || *md1==' ') *md1= 0;
00604                         md1++;
00605                     }
00606                     
00607                     /* read types and names until first character that is not '}' */
00608                     md1= md+1;
00609                     while ( *md1 != '}' ) {
00610                         if (md1>mainend) break;
00611                         
00612                         /* skip when it says 'struct' or 'unsigned' or 'const' */
00613                         if (*md1) {
00614                             if ( strncmp(md1, "struct", 6)==0 ) md1+= 7;
00615                             if ( strncmp(md1, "unsigned", 8)==0 ) md1+= 9;
00616                             if ( strncmp(md1, "const", 5)==0 ) md1+= 6;
00617                             
00618                             /* we've got a type! */
00619                             type= add_type(md1, 0);
00620                             if (type == -1) {
00621                                 printf("File '%s' contains struct we can't parse \"%s\"\n", filename, md1);
00622                                 return 1;
00623                             }
00624 
00625                             if (debugSDNA > 1) printf("\t|\t|\tfound type %s (", md1);
00626 
00627                             md1+= strlen(md1);
00628 
00629                             
00630                             /* read until ';' */
00631                             while ( *md1 != ';' ) {
00632                                 if (md1>mainend) break;
00633                                 
00634                                 if (*md1) {
00635                                     /* We've got a name. slen needs
00636                                      * correction for function
00637                                      * pointers! */
00638                                     slen= (int) strlen(md1);
00639                                     if ( md1[slen-1]==';' ) {
00640                                         md1[slen-1]= 0;
00641 
00642 
00643                                         name= add_name(md1);
00644                                         slen += additional_slen_offset;
00645                                         sp[0]= type;
00646                                         sp[1]= name;
00647 
00648                                         if ((debugSDNA>1) && (names[name] != NULL)) printf("%s |", names[name]);
00649 
00650                                         structpoin[1]++;
00651                                         sp+= 2;
00652                                                                                     
00653                                         md1+= slen;
00654                                         break;
00655                                     }
00656                                     
00657 
00658                                     name= add_name(md1);
00659                                     slen += additional_slen_offset;
00660 
00661                                     sp[0]= type;
00662                                     sp[1]= name;
00663                                     if ((debugSDNA > 1) && (names[name] != NULL)) printf("%s ||", names[name]);
00664 
00665                                     structpoin[1]++;
00666                                     sp+= 2;
00667                                     
00668                                     md1+= slen;
00669                                 }
00670                                 md1++;
00671                             }
00672 
00673                             if (debugSDNA > 1) printf(")\n");
00674 
00675                         }
00676                         md1++;
00677                     }
00678                 }
00679             }
00680         }
00681         count++;
00682         md++;
00683     }
00684     
00685     MEM_freeN(maindata);
00686 
00687     return 0;
00688 }
00689 
00690 static int arraysize(char *astr, int len)
00691 {
00692     int a, mul=1;
00693     char str[100], *cp=NULL;
00694 
00695     memcpy(str, astr, len+1);
00696     
00697     for (a=0; a<len; a++) {
00698         if ( str[a]== '[' ) {
00699             cp= &(str[a+1]);
00700         }
00701         else if ( str[a]==']' && cp) {
00702             str[a]= 0;
00703             /* if 'cp' is a preprocessor definition, it will evaluate to 0,
00704              * the caller needs to check for this case and throw an error */
00705             mul*= atoi(cp);
00706         }
00707     }
00708     
00709     return mul;
00710 }
00711 
00712 static int calculate_structlens(int firststruct)
00713 {
00714     int a, b, len, alphalen, unknown= nr_structs, lastunknown, structtype, type, mul, namelen;
00715     short *sp, *structpoin;
00716     char *cp;
00717     int has_pointer, dna_error = 0;
00718         
00719     while (unknown) {
00720         lastunknown= unknown;
00721         unknown= 0;
00722         
00723         /* check all structs... */
00724         for (a=0; a<nr_structs; a++) {
00725             structpoin= structs[a];
00726             structtype= structpoin[0];
00727 
00728             /* when length is not known... */
00729             if (typelens[structtype]==0) {
00730                 
00731                 sp= structpoin+2;
00732                 len= 0;
00733                 alphalen = 0;
00734                 has_pointer = 0;
00735                 
00736                 /* check all elements in struct */
00737                 for (b=0; b<structpoin[1]; b++, sp+=2) {
00738                     type= sp[0];
00739                     cp= names[sp[1]];
00740 
00741                     namelen= (int) strlen(cp);
00742                     /* is it a pointer or function pointer? */
00743                     if (cp[0]=='*' || cp[1]=='*') {
00744                         has_pointer = 1;
00745                         /* has the name an extra length? (array) */
00746                         mul= 1;
00747                         if ( cp[namelen-1]==']') mul= arraysize(cp, namelen);
00748 
00749                         if (mul == 0) {
00750                             printf("Zero array size found or could not parse %s: '%.*s'\n", types[structtype], namelen + 1, cp);
00751                             dna_error = 1;
00752                         }
00753 
00754                         /* 4-8 aligned/ */
00755                         if (sizeof(void *) == 4) {
00756                             if (len % 4) {
00757                                 printf("Align pointer error in struct (len4): %s %s\n", types[structtype], cp);
00758                                 dna_error = 1;
00759                             }
00760                         }
00761                         else {
00762                             if (len % 8) {
00763                                 printf("Align pointer error in struct (len8): %s %s\n", types[structtype], cp);
00764                                 dna_error = 1;
00765                             }
00766                         }
00767 
00768                         if (alphalen % 8) {
00769                             printf("Align pointer error in struct (alphalen8): %s %s\n", types[structtype],cp);
00770                             dna_error = 1;
00771                         }
00772 
00773                         len += sizeof(void *) * mul;
00774                         alphalen += 8 * mul;
00775 
00776                     }
00777                     else if (cp[0]=='[') {
00778                         /* parsing can cause names "var" and "[3]" to be found for "float var [3]" ... */
00779                         printf("Parse error in struct, invalid member name: %s %s\n", types[structtype], cp);
00780                         dna_error = 1;
00781                     }
00782                     else if ( typelens[type] ) {
00783                         /* has the name an extra length? (array) */
00784                         mul= 1;
00785                         if ( cp[namelen-1]==']') mul= arraysize(cp, namelen);
00786 
00787                         if (mul == 0) {
00788                             printf("Zero array size found or could not parse %s: '%.*s'\n", types[structtype], namelen + 1, cp);
00789                             dna_error = 1;
00790                         }
00791 
00792                         /* struct alignment */
00793                         if (type >= firststruct) {
00794                             if (sizeof(void *)==8 && (len % 8) ) {
00795                                 printf("Align struct error: %s %s\n", types[structtype],cp);
00796                                 dna_error = 1;
00797                             }
00798                         }
00799                         
00800                         /* 2-4 aligned/ */
00801                         if (typelens[type]>3 && (len % 4) ) {
00802                             printf("Align 4 error in struct: %s %s (add %d padding bytes)\n", types[structtype], cp, len%4);
00803                             dna_error = 1;
00804                         }
00805                         else if (typelens[type]==2 && (len % 2) ) {
00806                             printf("Align 2 error in struct: %s %s (add %d padding bytes)\n", types[structtype], cp, len%2);
00807                             dna_error = 1;
00808                         }
00809 
00810                         len += mul*typelens[type];
00811                         alphalen += mul * alphalens[type];
00812                         
00813                     }
00814                     else {
00815                         len= 0;
00816                         alphalen = 0;
00817                         break;
00818                     }
00819                 }
00820                 
00821                 if (len==0) {
00822                     unknown++;
00823                 }
00824                 else {
00825                     typelens[structtype]= len;
00826                     alphalens[structtype]= alphalen;
00827                     // two ways to detect if a struct contains a pointer:
00828                     // has_pointer is set or alphalen != len
00829                     if (has_pointer || alphalen != len) {
00830                         if (alphalen % 8) {
00831                             printf("Sizeerror 8 in struct: %s (add %d bytes)\n", types[structtype], alphalen%8);
00832                             dna_error = 1;
00833                         }
00834                     }
00835                     
00836                     if (len % 4) {
00837                         printf("Sizeerror 4 in struct: %s (add %d bytes)\n", types[structtype], len%4);
00838                         dna_error = 1;
00839                     }
00840                     
00841                 }
00842             }
00843         }
00844         
00845         if (unknown==lastunknown) break;
00846     }
00847     
00848     if (unknown) {
00849         printf("ERROR: still %d structs unknown\n", unknown);
00850 
00851         if (debugSDNA) {
00852             printf("*** Known structs :\n");
00853             
00854             for (a=0; a<nr_structs; a++) {
00855                 structpoin= structs[a];
00856                 structtype= structpoin[0];
00857                 
00858                 /* length unknown */
00859                 if (typelens[structtype]!=0) {
00860                     printf("  %s\n", types[structtype]);
00861                 }
00862             }
00863         }
00864 
00865             
00866         printf("*** Unknown structs :\n");
00867             
00868         for (a=0; a<nr_structs; a++) {
00869             structpoin= structs[a];
00870             structtype= structpoin[0];
00871 
00872             /* length unknown yet */
00873             if (typelens[structtype]==0) {
00874                 printf("  %s\n", types[structtype]);
00875             }
00876         }
00877     }
00878 
00879     return(dna_error);
00880 }
00881 
00882 #define MAX_DNA_LINE_LENGTH 20
00883 
00884 void dna_write(FILE *file, void *pntr, int size)
00885 {
00886     static int linelength = 0;
00887     int i;
00888     char *data;
00889 
00890     data = (char *) pntr;
00891     
00892     for (i = 0 ; i < size ; i++)
00893     {
00894         fprintf(file, "%d,", data[i]);
00895         linelength++;
00896         if (linelength >= MAX_DNA_LINE_LENGTH) {
00897             fprintf(file, "\n");
00898             linelength = 0;
00899         }
00900     }
00901 }
00902 
00903 void printStructLenghts(void)
00904 {
00905     int a, unknown= nr_structs, structtype;
00906     /*int lastunknown;*/ /*UNUSED*/
00907     short *structpoin;
00908     printf("\n\n*** All detected structs:\n");
00909 
00910     while (unknown) {
00911         /*lastunknown= unknown;*/ /*UNUSED*/
00912         unknown= 0;
00913         
00914         /* check all structs... */
00915         for (a=0; a<nr_structs; a++) {
00916             structpoin= structs[a];
00917             structtype= structpoin[0];
00918             printf("\t%s\t:%d\n", types[structtype], typelens[structtype]);
00919         }
00920     }
00921 
00922     printf("*** End of list\n");
00923 
00924 }
00925 
00926 
00927 static int make_structDNA(char *baseDirectory, FILE *file)
00928 {
00929     int len, i;
00930     short *sp;
00931     /* str contains filenames. Since we now include paths, I stretched       */
00932     /* it a bit. Hope this is enough :) -nzc-                                */
00933     char str[SDNA_MAX_FILENAME_LENGTH], *cp;
00934     int firststruct;
00935     
00936     if (debugSDNA > -1) {
00937         fflush(stdout);
00938         printf("Running makesdna at debug level %d\n", debugSDNA);
00939     }
00940         
00941     /* the longest known struct is 50k, so we assume 100k is sufficent! */
00942     namedata= MEM_callocN(maxdata, "namedata");
00943     typedata= MEM_callocN(maxdata, "typedata");
00944     structdata= MEM_callocN(maxdata, "structdata");
00945     
00946     /* a maximum of 5000 variables, must be sufficient? */
00947     names= MEM_callocN(sizeof(char *)*maxnr, "names");
00948     types= MEM_callocN(sizeof(char *)*maxnr, "types");
00949     typelens= MEM_callocN(sizeof(short)*maxnr, "typelens");
00950     alphalens= MEM_callocN(sizeof(short)*maxnr, "alphalens");
00951     structs= MEM_callocN(sizeof(short)*maxnr, "structs");
00952 
00953     /* insertion of all known types */
00954     /* watch it: uint is not allowed! use in structs an unsigned int */
00955     /* watch it: sizes must match DNA_elem_type_size() */
00956     add_type("char", 1);    /* SDNA_TYPE_CHAR */
00957     add_type("uchar", 1);   /* SDNA_TYPE_UCHAR */
00958     add_type("short", 2);   /* SDNA_TYPE_SHORT */
00959     add_type("ushort", 2);  /* SDNA_TYPE_USHORT */
00960     add_type("int", 4);     /* SDNA_TYPE_INT */
00961     add_type("long", 4);    /* SDNA_TYPE_LONG */        /* should it be 8 on 64 bits? */
00962     add_type("ulong", 4);   /* SDNA_TYPE_ULONG */
00963     add_type("float", 4);   /* SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT */
00964     add_type("double", 8);  /* SDNA_TYPE_DOUBLE */
00965     add_type("int64_t", 8); /* SDNA_TYPE_INT64 */
00966     add_type("uint64_t", 8); /* SDNA_TYPE_UINT64 */
00967     add_type("void", 0);    /* SDNA_TYPE_VOID */
00968 
00969     // the defines above shouldn't be output in the padding file...
00970     firststruct = nr_types;
00971     
00972     /* add all include files defined in the global array                     */
00973     /* Since the internal file+path name buffer has limited length, I do a   */
00974     /* little test first...                                                  */
00975     /* Mind the breaking condition here!                                     */
00976     if (debugSDNA) printf("\tStart of header scan:\n"); 
00977     for (i = 0; strlen(includefiles[i]); i++) {
00978         sprintf(str, "%s%s", baseDirectory, includefiles[i]);
00979           if (debugSDNA) printf("\t|-- Converting %s\n", str); 
00980         if (convert_include(str)) {
00981             return (1);
00982         }
00983     }
00984     if (debugSDNA) printf("\tFinished scanning %d headers.\n", i); 
00985 
00986     if (calculate_structlens(firststruct)) {
00987         // error
00988         return(1);
00989     }
00990 
00991     /* FOR DEBUG */
00992     if (debugSDNA > 1) {
00993         int a,b;
00994 /*          short *elem; */
00995         short num_types;
00996 
00997         printf("nr_names %d nr_types %d nr_structs %d\n", nr_names, nr_types, nr_structs);
00998         for (a=0; a<nr_names; a++) { 
00999             printf(" %s\n", names[a]);
01000         }
01001         printf("\n");
01002         
01003         sp= typelens;
01004         for (a=0; a<nr_types; a++, sp++) { 
01005             printf(" %s %d\n", types[a], *sp);
01006         }
01007         printf("\n");
01008         
01009         for (a=0; a<nr_structs; a++) {
01010             sp= structs[a];
01011             printf(" struct %s elems: %d size: %d\n", types[sp[0]], sp[1],typelens[sp[0]]);
01012             num_types  = sp[1];
01013             sp+= 2;
01014             /* ? num_types was elem? */
01015             for (b=0; b< num_types; b++, sp+= 2) {
01016                 printf("   %s %s\n", types[sp[0]], names[sp[1]]);
01017             }
01018         }
01019     }
01020 
01021     /* file writing */
01022 
01023     if (debugSDNA > -1) printf("Writing file ... ");
01024         
01025     if (nr_names==0 || nr_structs==0);
01026     else {
01027         strcpy(str, "SDNA");
01028         dna_write(file, str, 4);
01029         
01030         /* write names */
01031         strcpy(str, "NAME");
01032         dna_write(file, str, 4);
01033         len= nr_names;
01034         dna_write(file, &len, 4);
01035         
01036         /* calculate size of datablock with strings */
01037         cp= names[nr_names-1];
01038         cp+= strlen(names[nr_names-1]) + 1;         /* +1: null-terminator */
01039         len= (intptr_t) (cp - (char*) names[0]);
01040         len= (len+3) & ~3;
01041         dna_write(file, names[0], len);
01042         
01043         /* write TYPES */
01044         strcpy(str, "TYPE");
01045         dna_write(file, str, 4);
01046         len= nr_types;
01047         dna_write(file, &len, 4);
01048     
01049         /* calculate datablock size */
01050         cp= types[nr_types-1];
01051         cp+= strlen(types[nr_types-1]) + 1;     /* +1: null-terminator */
01052         len= (intptr_t) (cp - (char*) types[0]);
01053         len= (len+3) & ~3;
01054         
01055         dna_write(file, types[0], len);
01056         
01057         /* WRITE TYPELENGTHS */
01058         strcpy(str, "TLEN");
01059         dna_write(file, str, 4);
01060         
01061         len= 2*nr_types;
01062         if (nr_types & 1) len+= 2;
01063         dna_write(file, typelens, len);
01064         
01065         /* WRITE STRUCTS */
01066         strcpy(str, "STRC");
01067         dna_write(file, str, 4);
01068         len= nr_structs;
01069         dna_write(file, &len, 4);
01070     
01071         /* calc datablock size */
01072         sp= structs[nr_structs-1];
01073         sp+= 2+ 2*( sp[1] );
01074         len= (intptr_t) ((char*) sp - (char*) structs[0]);
01075         len= (len+3) & ~3;
01076         
01077         dna_write(file, structs[0], len);
01078     
01079         /* a simple dna padding test */
01080         if (0) {
01081             FILE *fp;
01082             int a;
01083             
01084             fp= fopen("padding.c", "w");
01085             if (fp==NULL);
01086             else {
01087 
01088                 // add all include files defined in the global array
01089                 for (i = 0; strlen(includefiles[i]); i++) {
01090                     fprintf(fp, "#include \"%s%s\"\n", baseDirectory, includefiles[i]);
01091                 }
01092 
01093                 fprintf(fp, "main() {\n");
01094                 sp = typelens;
01095                 sp += firststruct;
01096                 for (a=firststruct; a<nr_types; a++, sp++) { 
01097                     if (*sp) {
01098                         fprintf(fp, "\tif (sizeof(struct %s) - %d) printf(\"ALIGN ERROR:", types[a], *sp);
01099                         fprintf(fp, "%%d %s %d ", types[a], *sp);
01100                         fprintf(fp, "\\n\",  sizeof(struct %s) - %d);\n", types[a], *sp);
01101                     }
01102                 }
01103                 fprintf(fp, "}\n");
01104                 fclose(fp);
01105             }
01106         }
01107         /*  end end padding test */
01108     }
01109     
01110     
01111     MEM_freeN(namedata);
01112     MEM_freeN(typedata);
01113     MEM_freeN(structdata);
01114     MEM_freeN(names);
01115     MEM_freeN(types);
01116     MEM_freeN(typelens);
01117     MEM_freeN(alphalens);
01118     MEM_freeN(structs);
01119 
01120     if (debugSDNA > -1) printf("done.\n");
01121     
01122     return(0);
01123 }
01124 
01125 /* ************************* END MAKE DNA ********************** */
01126 
01127 static void make_bad_file(const char *file, int line)
01128 {
01129     FILE *fp= fopen(file, "w");
01130     fprintf(fp, "#error \"Error! can't make correct DNA.c file from %s:%d, STUPID!\"\n", __FILE__, line);
01131     fclose(fp);
01132 }
01133 
01134 #ifndef BASE_HEADER
01135 #define BASE_HEADER "../"
01136 #endif
01137 
01138 int main(int argc, char ** argv)
01139 {
01140     FILE *file;
01141     int return_status = 0;
01142 
01143     if (argc!=2 && argc!=3) {
01144         printf("Usage: %s outfile.c [base directory]\n", argv[0]);
01145         return_status = 1;
01146     }
01147     else {
01148         file = fopen(argv[1], "w");
01149         if (!file) {
01150             printf ("Unable to open file: %s\n", argv[1]);
01151             return_status = 1;
01152         }
01153         else {
01154             char baseDirectory[256];
01155 
01156             if (argc==3) {
01157                 strcpy(baseDirectory, argv[2]);
01158             }
01159             else {
01160                 strcpy(baseDirectory, BASE_HEADER);
01161             }
01162 
01163             fprintf (file, "unsigned char DNAstr[]= {\n");
01164             if (make_structDNA(baseDirectory, file)) {
01165                 // error
01166                 fclose(file);
01167                 make_bad_file(argv[1], __LINE__);
01168                 return_status = 1;
01169             }
01170             else {
01171                 fprintf(file, "};\n");
01172                 fprintf(file, "int DNAlen= sizeof(DNAstr);\n");
01173     
01174                 fclose(file);
01175             }
01176         }
01177     }
01178 
01179         
01180     return(return_status);
01181 }
